metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5256 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Node.js 0.8 before 0.8.28 and 0.10 before 0.10.30 does not consider the possibility of recursive processing that triggers V8 garbage collection in conjunction with a V8 interrupt, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via deep JSON objects whose parsing lets this interrupt mask an overflow of the program stack.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> CVE is for nodejs, but nodejs package uses system libv8 mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
